title: She Made a Career of Writing About Women. Now She Worries About Men
description: Caitlin Moran spoke to TIME about what she had discovered about men, and offered some solutions to what ails them gleaned from her time in the feminist trenches.

title: Kevin McCarthy’s Shutdown Dilemma
description: He can either shut down the government and possibly save his standing with the GOP hardliners threatening to oust him, or work with Democrats to pass a short-term spending bill and avert a government shutdown—potentially at the expense of his own speakership.

title: The Most Famous Historian of Rome on Why Men Are Obsessed
description: Mary Beard weighs in on the latest TikTok trend and why Romans would have loved social media.

title: How Internet Nepo-Friends Have Cultivated Their Own Online Stardom
description: In a wildly competitive landscape for influencers, having a famous BFF has many advantages.

title: Britain Is Failing Citizens Who Are Arbitrarily Jailed Abroad
description: Families of those detained tell TIME that the British government has proven unwilling to use its leverage to seek their loved ones' release.

title: Voters May Blame Republicans For a Shutdown—But Not Punish Them
description: The legend in Washington is that the 2013 shutdown led Virginia Democrats to a blowout win. Is it true?

title: Tuberculosis Could Be the Next Global Health Crisis. Is the World Ready?
description: The world is mobilizing to prevent the spread of tuberculosis, which kills 1.5 million people a year.

title: FTC and 17 States Sue Amazon, Alleging Price Inflation and Overcharging of Sellers
description: The Federal Trade Commission and 17 state attorney generals filed an antitrust lawsuit against Amazon.

title: Does It Matter Which COVID-19 Booster Shot You Get?
description: With a new booster available, it’s time to look at whether switching up your shots makes a difference in your immunity

title: The Growing Danger of Dams
description: Deadly dam failures will become more common, and removing them helps reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Sen. Cory Booker Calls on New Jersey Colleague Bob Menendez to Resign
description: Sen. Cory Booker is calling on his fellow New Jersey Democrat Sen. Bob Menendez to resign after federal bribery charges against him.

title: The Kevin James Meme That’s Taking Over the Internet
description: The comedian's face is being used to depict a range of scenarios online. Here's where the meme came from.

title: Conservatives Aren’t Just Boycotting Bud Light. They’re Trying to Build a Parallel Economy
description: As Investors target right-wing alternatives to mainstream brands, will the US economy reshape itself to be as polarized as our electorate?

title: TIME and the American Society of Media Photographers Launch Global Photographic Portraiture Competition: “The Human Element”
description: Prizes include paid TIME photo assignment, custom three-month mentorship with the photo editors of TIME, and over $16,000 in cash prizes for the winners 2024 event honoring winners to be held in New York City TIME, the 100-year-old global media brand that reaches a combined audience of over 120 million around the world across its…

title: HBO’s Savior Complex Indicts the White Supremacy of American Do-Gooders in Africa
description: The HBO docuseries uncovers the racially charged hubris of well-meaning, white, often evangelical Americans in Africa.

title: What the Luddites Can Teach Us About Artificial Intelligence
description: Author Brian Merchant says the Luddites have never been more relevant.

title: Soaring Solar Power and EV Sales Gives Hope for Hitting 1.5°C Global Warming Target
description: Growth in solar power and EVs has been consistent with meeting 1.5C warming target says IEA, but more must be done to hit Paris climate goal.

title: How Civil Rights Were Made—and Remade—By Black Communities In the Jim Crow South
description: Civil rights were vindicated in courts, but they were made by people pursuing their everyday lives, writes Dylan C. Penningroth.

title: Rooftop Solar Power Has a Dark Side
description: Homeowners across the U.S. installed leased solar systems on their rooftops. Now, the panels are failing and the companies that own them have gone out of business.

title: The Myths Holding Back Police Reform
description: A cop turned sociologist details the realities overlooked by advocates on both sides of the debate over policing.

title: How to Make Russia Pay to Rebuild Ukraine
description: $300 billion of Russian assets have been seized since the Ukraine invasion. That money should be put towards rebuilding Ukraine

title: Macron Is Pushing Europe Into $900 Billion Fight With China
description: The E.U.'s new, tougher approach to China is shaped by French concerns that Beijing’s trade practices will pose a threat to core industries.

title: Thai Protest Leader Arnon Nampa Sentenced to Four-Year Prison Term on Royal Insult Charge
description: Human rights lawyer Arnon Nampa was among dozens of pro-democracy activists charged under Thailand’s controversial lese-majeste law in 2021.
